title: (x) Monoline scripts - various {gang}
content: Which (bold) monoline scripts exist except of Monoline Script?
author: thorsten_geiger

comments.content:
[Kaufmann Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/kaufmann/) comes to mind immediately.   
   
As does Nick Shinn's [Handsome Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=SHT0000008)   
   
Letraset's [Santa Fe](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=LFT1058400) is very clean.   
   
And Typodelic's [Natural Script Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typadelic/natural-script/bold/) isn't too bad.   
   
Neil Summerour's [Luce](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000004) probably isn't as bold as you need, but it's definitely monolinear.   
   
 [Gilles Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/gillies-gothic/) is probably a bit too displayish.

I love this forum for the quick and helpful inspirational responses. Thanks Grant and Stephen!   
Santa Fe is the direction I'm going for. It's more generic, constructed than the nice "Handsome". But the "e" ... . French Letters looks good to me in the lower letters. Poppl-College and Signal (a little bit to edgy) are cool, Tarantula is supercool,except of some too postmodern features like the "V".   
   
I'm thinking of making a logoish monoline script font. Perhaps it could also look a little bit painted. Something like a bold template handwriting. It's gonna be used for a serious of logos in an art project.   
I just want to check: Whats in this field of "template handwriting"? Do you know more contemporary logos based on (custom) handwriting?

Thanks again,   
I don't know if I like the "U" but I like the lettering.   
Whodunnit?

Santa Fe looks more like neon to me than handwriting. If you're going for a hand painted look you could try some of House Industries [sign painter](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=SIGN-FO&sub=view) collection.

\> Whodunnit?   
   
Actually it was Wolff-Olins not Landor. The U was designed by one Miles Newlyn. The script, I'm not sure.
[terital](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224136/http:/www.the-letterbox.com.au/lab/fonts/fonts5terital.html) from Letterbox is a nice one, no uppercase though.
yes, terital is cool. I like the letterbox-logo too.
